Frontmatter and Liquid

This is quite meta, but data can be picked up automatically within the double curly brackets.

---
title: Frontmatter
---

And later: {{ title }}

By default uses liquid, a templating language from Shopify, but you can use other templates using a config file.

I heard good things from Chris Coyier regarding Nunjucks, so I'll give that one a trial. In a .eleventy.js file in the root folder:

module.exports = {
  markdownTemplateEngine: "njk"
};

Testing things out with a quick if statement.


There is a title

For a template: add a _includes folder at the root of the website. In here, a layout.njk file describes the following template.

<!doctype html>

<html lang="en">
<head>
  <title>Frontmatter and Liquid</title>
</head>

<body>
  
</body>

</hml>

Refer to the layout file within the front matter.

layout: layout.njk

Small hitch. It's not content in njk, although that would work if you were to use liquid.

layout: layout.liquid

With njk, content the markup is pasted a string....It seems it's not enough to import nunjuck. Youneed to actually install it and consider more options. To make due without the pain, I'll roll back to liquid for the time being.
